results.title: Labyrinth of passion = Laberinto de pasiones
results.creator_credit: Alphaville S A and Pedro Almodovar
results.brief_description: Almodovar has taken the setting of Madrid as the centrepoint for this labyrinth of love, lust and passion. Sexilla the sex fiend is in love with Riza Niro, heir to a fallen Arab empire. Riza’s preoccupations are men and cosmetics. Set against a city of music, persecution, obsession and uncertain futures. Cast includes Antonio Banderas, Ceilia Roth, Imanol Arias and Fernando Vivanco. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Labyrinth
results.creator_credit: Eric Rattray, Lucasfilm, Ltd. and Jim Henson
results.brief_description: Take a journey into the Labyrinth, where nothing is as it seems. Sarah (Jennifer Connelly) spends most of her time play-acting scenes from her favourite book, The Labyrinth, or baby-sitting her younger brother, Toby. One night, frustrated with Toby’s incessant crying, she begs the goblins to take him away. When Toby actually disappears, Sarah follows him into the world of the wicked Goblin King (David Bowie), where she is given thirteen hours to conquer the Labyrinth, before her baby brother is turned into a goblin forever. An engaging fantasy film, populated by creatures created by Jim Henson’s Creature Shop, and drawing inspiration from a number of sources, including the works of Brian Froud, Maurice Sendak and M. C. Escher. Includes a special behind-the-scenes featurette detailing the making of Labyrinth.

results.title: Labrador Hospital
results.creator_credit: Rex Tasker, ONF | NFB and Kryn Taconis
results.brief_description: A documentary study of the Grenfell Mission, a voluntary medical group that has served Atlantic fishermen and the isolated communities of Newfoundland and Labrador since 1892. Focus of the film is the Mission’s headquarters hospital at St. Anthony and the modern system of airlifting up to 5000 patients a year to hospital.

results.title: Labour of love = Heller wahn
results.creator_credit: Eberhard Junkersdorf, Bioskop Film, Les Films du Losange and Margarethe Von Trotta
results.brief_description: Labour of love is a sharp edged study of the relationship between two women and its effect on their lives. The film focuses on the friendship of two very different women. Olga is a lecturer in German literature, separated from her husband and living with her teenage son and a talented, but unsuccessful, musician whom she loves and supports. She meets Ruth, a shy, depressive woman, married to Franz, and becomes interested in her. As their friendship develops the men in their lives feel increasingly threatened and unintentionally increase pressure on both the women. Stars Angela Winkler and Hanna Schygulla.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eberhard Junkersdorf, Bioskop Film, Les Films du Losange and Margarethe Von Trotta

results.title: Labour of Love
results.creator_credit: Martyn Down, Imago, Pumpkin Films and Harriet Clutterbuck
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the positive aspects of home childbirth following the experiences of several families. Interviews their midwives about the advantages of having a baby amongst family and friends in familiar surroundings.

results.title: Labour and capital mobility (NP)
results.creator_credit: Craig Saunders, Ashley Schwall-Kearney, Monash University, ABC-TV (Australia) and Open Learning Agency of Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Global Economy”.
The increasing globalisation of the international economy has resulted in labour shifting across the globe in search of employment opportunities. This episode of the Open Learning Economics course examines national economies reliant emigration and immigration cycles. The first half of the program examines the relationship between the Netherlands and Turkey. In the late 1960s Holland began to accept a large number of Turkish immigrants who were leaving their home country due to the decimation of the traditional agricultural economy. For Holland, the Turkish people provided a pool of cheap labour, while for Turkey, its economy became dependant on the wages the immigrants sent back to their home country. The second part showcases Mexico and United States where in order to alleviate the social problems caused by extensive Mexican immigrant labour in the US, the two countries have entered into an economic union which allows American companies to move their capital to Mexico. The panel discussion looks at the ramifications of this agreement (part of the North American Free Trade Agreement - NAFTA) on unemployment and labour relations in both the “host” and “home” nations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Craig Saunders, Ashley Schwall-Kearney, Monash University, ABC-TV (Australia) and Open Learning Agency of Australia

results.title: Labor in power
results.creator_credit: Sue Spencer and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: In a decade of profound change, from 1983 to 1993, the ABC Television News and Current Affairs Political Documentary Unit compiled a unique series, capturing the key elements of the Australian Labour Party’s ten-year rule. The battle between Bob Hawke and Paul Keating for the Labor Party leadership was one of the most divisive in Australian political history the seeds of which can be traced back as far as 1980. The series is an intensely personal examination of the Hawke-Keating relationship, and through more than 120 interviews with Cabinet Ministers, senior bureaucrats and staff advisers, the series offers an insider’s view of who wields power in Australia, and how. The five episodes are; “Taking power”, “Taxing times”, “Conserving power”, “The recession we had to have” and “The sweetest victory”.

results.title: Labor and childbirth
results.creator_credit: D.M. Hatfield and Photo & Sound Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Education for Childbirth”.
A young couple expects their first child. Shows onset of labor, the trip to the hospital, call to doctor, admission to maternity ward, routine preparations for delivery, including instructions to mother, and normal birth of child. Stresses the assumption that fear stems from lack of knowledge.

results.title: Labirynt
results.creator_credit: Studio Miniatur Filmowych, Warszawie Przedstawia Film and Jan Lenica
results.brief_description: Jan Lenica’s diverse animation techniques in this film create a cruel and absurd world from which escape is impossible - anyone caught up in this Kafka-like nightmare can only persist, undeterred.

results.title: La Voie Lactee = the Milky Way
results.brief_description:
Pierre and Jean journey to a holy shrine in Northern Spain (Santiago de Compostella). Are they pilgrims or tramps? No one knows their identity or their true motives. During this timeless intitiatic journey, their faith is severely tested by some of the irreverent characters they confront in the course of their pilgrimage. Even chance meetings with Jesus Christ, the Virgin Mary and the Devil are not quite what Pierre and Jean have been prepared for in their religious training. This late Bunuel film is one of his most direct treatment of the Catholic Church and the six central mysteries of Catholic dogma: the nature of God, Christ, the Virgin Mary, the Eucharist, divine grace and evil.

Credits: Producer, Serge Silberman ; director, Luis Bunuel ; writers, Luis Bunuel, Jean-Claude Carriere ; photography, Christian Matras ; music, Luis Bunuel.
Cast: Delphine Seyrig, Laurent Terzieff, Ellen Bahl, Paul Frankeur, Agnes Capri, Julien Berthau, Augusta Carriere, Julien Guiomar, Muni, Georges Marchal.
